newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore housing board to sell two land sites.
newsitem.headline: Singapore housing board to sell two land sites.

text.p: Singapore's Housing and Development Board (HDB) said on Wednesday it would tender out to the private sector this month two plots of land for the development of executive condominiums.
The HDB, a government body that builds subsidised housing, said in a statement this was the first time land would be tendered out for executive condominiums.

Under the government's Executive Condominium (EC) scheme introduced in 1995, private developers can tender for government-subsidised land to build condominiums with the quality and facilties normally provided by the private sector.
But they have to price the condominums at affordable rates as they can only be bought by households with incomes not exceeding Singapore $10,000 a month.
The HDB statement said the two plots of land offered for tender were in Jurong West and Woodlands, in the western part of Singapore.
It said three more sites would be offered for sale later this year.
Three new executive condominium projects will be launched in the next few months. These projects will be developed on land allocated to government-linked companies.
So far eight sites for such developments have been allocated to government-linked companies and three were launched between June 1996 and January 1997, the statement said.
